original_title: Sri Lanka, EU sign financing agreement to promote food sustainability
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has signed a financing agreement with the European Union to promote sustainable food consumption, state minister for finance Shehan Semasinghe said.
“The government and the European Union signed a financing agreement to promote a circular economy, sustainable consumption and production in the food sector.”

“The grant of EUR 15 million from the EU aims to increase food availability for vulnerable people through more efficient distribution of food, avoiding food waste or convert food waste into much needed farming inputs like organic fertilizer, animal feed, etc.”
Food security has been a concern for Sri Lanka in the recent past, especially after last year’s economic crisis, and in the face of rising climate concerns.

A collective of United Nations food agencies have highlighted an urgent need for Sri Lanka to transform its agrifood systems due to the island nation being a highly water stressed country that also ranks high on the Global Climate Risk Index. (Colombo/Nov27/2023)
